column9: secondaryMuscles__003
column10: instructions__001
column11: instructions__002
column12: instructions__003
column13: instructions__004
column14: instructions__005
column15: instructions__006
column16: instructions__007

column10: Sit on the cable machine with your back straight and feet flat on the ground.
column11: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Lean back slightly and pull the handles towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
column13: Pause for a moment at the peak of the movement, then slowly release the handles back to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column11: Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
column12: As you pull yourself up, bend one arm and bring your elbow towards your side, while keeping the other arm straight.
column13: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar and your bent arm is fully flexed.
column14: Lower yourself back down with control, straightening the bent arm and repeating the movement on the other side.
column15: Alternate sides with each repetition.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height.
column11: Place your hands on the parallel bars with a close grip, palms facing each other.
column12: Hang from the bars with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
column13: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the bars, keeping your elbows close to your body.
column14: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bars.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height settings.
column11: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Hang with your arms fully extended and your feet off the ground.
column13: Engage your back muscles and pull your body up towards the handles, keeping your elbows close to your body.
column14: Continue pulling until your chin is above the handles.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired assistance level.
column11: Stand on the foot platform and grip the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Keep your chest up and shoulders back, engage your core, and slightly bend your knees.
column13: Pull your body up by flexing your elbows and driving your elbows down towards your sides.
column14: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your body back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height settings.
column11: Stand facing the machine with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column12: Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column13: Engage your lats and biceps, and pull yourself up towards the handles.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, squeezing your back muscles.
column15: Slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Place the stability ball on the ground and lie face down on top of it, with your hips resting on the ball and your feet against a wall or other stable surface.
column11: Position your hands behind your head or crossed over your chest.
column12: Engage your core and slowly lift your upper body off the ball, extending your back until your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: core
column10: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column11: Engage your core and pull your shoulder blades down and back.
column12: Bend your knees and tuck them towards your chest.
column13: Slowly lift your legs up, keeping them straight, until your body is parallel to the ground.
column14: Hold this position for a few seconds, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand tall with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column11: Extend your arms straight out in front of you, parallel to the ground.
column12: Cross your arms in front of your body, with your right arm over your left arm.
column13: Interlock your fingers and rotate your palms away from your body.
column14: Slowly raise your arms up and away from your body, feeling a stretch in your back and chest.
column15: Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds, then release.
column16: Repeat on the opposite side.

column10: Attach the band to a pull-up bar or sturdy anchor point.
column11: Step onto the band and grip the bar with your palms facing away from you, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Hang with your arms fully extended, keeping your core engaged and your shoulders down and back.
column13: Pull your body up towards the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together and driving your elbows down towards your hips.
column14: Continue pulling until your chin is above the bar, then slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: core
column10: Start in a push-up position with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column11: Extend one arm straight out to the side, parallel to the ground.
column12: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and core engaged.
column13: Push back up to the starting position.
column14: Repeat on the other side, extending the opposite arm out to the side.
column15: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired height and secure your knees on the pad.
column11: Grasp the handles with your palms facing down and your arms fully extended.
column12: Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
column13: Pause for a moment, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: assisted seated pectoralis major stretch with stability ball
column10: Sit on a stability ball with your feet flat on the ground and your back straight.
column11: Hold a stability ball with both hands and extend your arms straight out in front of you.
column12: Slowly lower the stability ball towards your chest, feeling a stretch in your pectoral muscles.
column13: Hold the stretch for a few seconds, then slowly return to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Adjust the machine to your desired height and secure your knees on the pad.
column11: Grasp the handles with a wide grip and keep your elbows slightly bent.
column12: Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor.
column13: Push yourself back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
column11: Grasp the band handles with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Extend your arms fully, pushing the bands away from your chest.
column13: Slowly lower the bands back down to your chest, keeping your elbows at a 90-degree angle.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: band one arm twisting chest press
column10: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at chest height.
column11: Stand with your side facing the anchor point and grab the band with one hand.
column12: Step away from the anchor point to create tension in the band.
column13: Position your feet shoulder-width apart and slightly bend your knees.
column14: Bring your hand holding the band across your body, towards the opposite shoulder.
column15: While maintaining tension in the band, push your hand forward and away from your body, extending your arm.
column16: Slowly return to the starting position and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
column17: Switch sides and repeat the exercise with the other hand.

column10: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
column11: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Lift the barbell off the rack and hold it directly above your chest with your arms fully extended.
column13: Lower the barbell slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
column14: Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
column15: Push the barbell back up to the starting position by extending your arms.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.
column11: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows tucked in.
column13: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push the barbell back up to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Lie down on a decline bench with your head lower than your hips and your feet secured.
column11: Hold the barbell with a pronated grip (palms facing away from you) and your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Extend your arms above your chest, keeping a slight bend in your elbows.
column13: Lower the barbell in an arc motion behind your head, feeling a stretch in your chest and shoulders.
column14: Pause for a moment, then return the barbell to the starting position by reversing the motion.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured and your head lower than your hips.
column11: Grasp the barbell with a wide grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Lower the barbell to your chest, keeping your elbows out to the sides.
column13: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a towel with both hands behind your head.
column10: Keep your elbows close to your ears and your upper arms stationary.
column11: Slowly extend your forearms upward, squeezing your triceps at the top.
column12: Pause for a moment, then slowly lower the towel back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Adjust the machine to your desired weight and height.
column10: Kneel down on the pad facing the machine, with your hands gripping the handles.
column11: Lower your body by bending your elbows, keeping your back straight and close to the machine.
column12: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push yourself back up to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
column10: Keep your elbows close to your sides and slowly curl one arm up towards your shoulder, squeezing your biceps at the top.
column11: Lower the arm back down to the starting position and repeat with the other arm.
column12: Continue alternating arms for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Place a band around your upper arms, just above the elbows.
column10: Assume a push-up position with your hands directly under your shoulders and your body in a straight line from head to heels.
column11: Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
column12: Push through your palms to extend your arms and return to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench or chair with your legs spread apart and your feet flat on the ground.
column10: Hold one end of the band in your hand and step on the other end with your foot on the same side.
column11: Lean forward slightly and rest your elbow on the inside of your thigh, just above the knee.
column12: With your palm facing up, slowly curl your hand towards your shoulder, keeping your upper arm stationary.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hand back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch sides.

column5: band one arm overhead biceps curl
column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place one end of the band under your foot.
column10: Hold the other end of the band with your arm fully extended overhead, palm facing forward.
column11: Keeping your upper arm stationary, curl your forearm towards your shoulder, squeezing your biceps.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your forearm back to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands, palms facing down.
column10: Extend your arms straight out to the sides, keeping them parallel to the ground.
column11: Slowly bend your elbows and bring your hands towards your shoulders, keeping your upper arms still.
column12: Pause for a moment, then slowly extend your arms back out to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in each hand, palms facing forward.
column10: Keep your upper arms stationary and exhale as you curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
column11: Continue to raise the barbells until your biceps are fully contracted and the barbells are at shoulder level.
column12: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
column13: Inhale as you slowly begin to lower the barbells back to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, alternating arms.

column9: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
column10: Place your upper arms against the arm blaster, keeping your elbows close to your torso.
column11: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps.
column12: Continue to raise the barbell until your biceps are fully contracted and the bar is at shoulder level.
column13: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeeze your biceps.
column14: Inhale and slowly begin to lower the barbell back to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Lie flat on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your back pressed against the bench.
column10: Grasp the barbell with a close grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width apart.
column11: Unrack the barbell and lower it slowly towards your chest, keeping your elbows close to your body.
column12: Pause for a moment when the barbell touches your chest.
column13: Push the barbell back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground.
column10: Hold the band with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and wrap it around your fingers.
column11: Rest your forearms on your thighs, with your wrists hanging off the edge.
column12: Slowly curl your wrists upward, squeezing your forearms.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench or chair with your feet flat on the ground.
column10: Hold the band with both hands, palms facing up, and rest your forearms on your thighs.
column11: Slowly curl your wrists upward, squeezing your forearms.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: barbell palms down wrist curl over a bench
column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, palms facing down.
column10: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
column11: Lower the barbell towards the ground by flexing your wrists, keeping your forearms stationary.
column12: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly raise the barbell back up by extending your wrists.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: barbell palms up wrist curl over a bench
column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up.
column10: Rest your forearms on the bench, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
column11: Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
column12: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
column10: Hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
column11: Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
column12: Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upward as far as possible.
column13: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
column10: Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
column11: Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your body.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand up straight with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip.
column10: Rest the barbell on the back of your hands with your palms facing down and your fingers pointing towards your body.
column11: Keeping your upper arms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upwards as far as possible.
column12: Hold the contracted position for a brief pause, then inhale and slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your forearms resting on your thighs, holding a barbell with an underhand grip.
column10: Allow the barbell to roll down to your fingertips, keeping your wrists straight.
column11: Slowly curl the barbell up towards your forearms by flexing your wrists.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the ground and your knees bent.
column10: Hold a barbell with an underhand grip, palms facing up, and your hands shoulder-width apart.
column11: Rest your forearms on your thighs, allowing your wrists to hang off the edge.
column12: Slowly curl your wrists upward, bringing the barbell towards your forearms.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Attach a cable to a low pulley and sit on a bench facing the cable machine.
column10: Grasp the cable handle with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
column11: Rest your forearms on your thighs, with your wrists hanging off the edge.
column12: Keeping your forearms stationary, exhale and curl your wrists upward as far as possible.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then inhale and slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band in front of your thighs with your palms facing down.
column11: Keep your arms straight and lift the band up in front of you until your arms are parallel to the ground.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the band back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band in front of your thighs with your palms facing down.
column11: Keep your arms straight and slowly raise them forward until they are parallel to the ground.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Attach the band to a stationary object at chest height.
column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band with both hands in front of you.
column12: Keep your arms straight and lift them out to the sides until they are parallel to the ground.
column13: Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
column14: Slowly lower your arms back to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band under your feet.
column11: Hold the band with your palms facing forward and raise your hands to shoulder height, elbows bent.
column12: Press the band overhead, fully extending your arms.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the band back to shoulder height.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: biceps
column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band under your feet.
column11: Hold the band handles with your palms facing each other and your arms extended in front of you.
column12: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
column13: Pull the band towards your chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band under your feet.
column11: Hold the band handles at shoulder height with your palms facing forward.
column12: Engage your core and press the band overhead, fully extending your arms.
column13: As you press, twist your torso to one side, keeping your hips stable.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, then return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat the press and twist on the opposite side.
column16: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold the band in front of your thighs with your palms facing inwards.
column11: Keep your arms straight and lift them up and out to the sides, forming a 'Y' shape with your body.
column12: Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the top of the movement.
column13: Slowly lower your arms back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip.
column11: Keep your arms straight and lift the barbell forward and upward until it reaches shoulder level.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: core
column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing slightly outwards.
column11: Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column12: Bend your knees and lower your hips into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest up.
column13: Explosively extend your hips, knees, and ankles, driving the barbell upwards.
column14: As the barbell reaches chest level, pull it upwards with your arm, keeping it close to your body.
column15: Rotate your elbow under the barbell and extend your arm fully overhead, locking out your elbow.
column16: Lower the barbell back down to the starting position in a controlled manner.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch arms.

column10: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, palms facing down.
column11: Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight.
column12: Raise the barbell out to the sides, keeping your arms straight, until they are parallel to the ground.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: calves
column13: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column14: Bend your knees and lower your body into a squat position.
column15: Jump explosively upwards, extending your legs and arms.
column16: While in the air, spread your legs apart and bring your arms out to the sides.
column17: Land softly with your feet shoulder-width apart, bending your knees to absorb the impact.
column18: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: glutes
column10: calves
column13: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column14: Step forward with your right foot, bending your knee and lowering your body into a lunge position.
column15: Push off with your right foot and step back to the starting position.
column16: Repeat the movement with your left foot, alternating legs with each step.
column17: Continue stepping back and forth, maintaining a steady pace.
column18: Repeat for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

column9: triceps
column13: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
column14: Lift your knees slightly off the ground, keeping your back flat and your core engaged.
column15: Move your right hand and left foot forward simultaneously, followed by your left hand and right foot.
column16: Continue crawling forward, alternating your hand and foot movements.
column17: Maintain a steady pace and keep your core tight throughout the exercise.
column18: Continue for the desired distance or time.

column9: calves
column10: shoulders
column11: chest
column13: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column14: Lower your body into a squat position by bending your knees and placing your hands on the floor in front of you.
column15: Kick your feet back into a push-up position.
column16: Perform a push-up, keeping your body in a straight line.
column17: Jump your feet back into the squat position.
column18: Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
column19: Land softly and immediately lower back into a squat position to begin the next repetition.

column9: glutes
column13: Adjust the seat height and position yourself on the cycle cross trainer.
column14: Place your feet on the pedals and grip the handlebars.
column15: Start pedaling in a smooth and controlled motion.
column16: Maintain a steady pace and increase the resistance if desired.
column17: Continue pedaling for the desired duration of your cardio workout.

column9: calves
column10: shoulders
column11: triceps
column12: core
column13: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart and a dumbbell in each hand.
column14: Lower your body into a squat position, placing the dumbbells on the ground in front of you.
column15: Kick your feet back into a push-up position, keeping your body in a straight line.
column16: Perform a push-up, bending your elbows and lowering your chest towards the ground.
column17: Jump your feet back towards your hands, landing in a squat position.
column18: Stand up explosively, lifting the dumbbells off the ground and bringing them to your shoulders.
column19: Press the dumbbells overhead, fully extending your arms.
column20: Lower the dumbbells back to your shoulders and repeat the entire sequence for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: glutes
column13: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column14: Bend your knees and lower your body down as if you were sitting back into a chair.
column15: Keep your chest up and your weight in your heels.
column16: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: glutes
column10: calves
column13: Stand facing a wall with your feet hip-width apart.
column14: Place your hands on the wall for support.
column15: Engage your core and lift your right knee up towards your chest, while keeping your left foot on the ground.
column16: Quickly switch legs, bringing your left knee up towards your chest and lowering your right foot back down.
column17: Continue alternating legs in a running motion, bringing your knees up as high as possible.
column18: Maintain a fast pace and keep your upper body stable throughout the exercise.
column19: Repeat for the desired duration or number of repetitions.

column9: calves
column10: shoulders
column11: triceps
column12: core
column13: Start in a standing position with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column14: Lower your body into a squat position, placing your hands on the ground in front of you.
column15: Kick your feet back, landing in a push-up position.
column16: Perform a push-up, lowering your chest to the ground and then pushing back up.
column17: Jump your feet forward, landing in a squat position.
column18: Jump up explosively, reaching your arms overhead.
column19: Land softly and immediately lower back into the squat position to begin the next repetition.

column13: Stand with your feet together and your arms by your sides.
column14: Jump up, spreading your feet apart and raising your arms above your head.
column15: As you land, quickly jump back to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand or sit up straight with your shoulders relaxed.
column10: Tilt your head to one side, bringing your ear towards your shoulder.
column11: Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
column12: Repeat on the other side.
column13: Perform 2-4 sets on each side.

column9: Stand or sit up straight with your shoulders relaxed.
column10: Tilt your head to the right, bringing your right ear towards your right shoulder.
column11: Place your right hand on the left side of your head and gently apply pressure to increase the stretch.
column12: Hold the stretch for 15-30 seconds.
column13: Repeat on the other side, tilting your head to the left and applying pressure with your left hand.
column14: Repeat the stretch 2-3 times on each side.

column9: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you.
column10: Lift one leg off the ground and rotate your ankle in a circular motion.
column11: Perform the desired number of circles in one direction, then switch to the other direction.
column12: Repeat with the other leg.

column9: Lie on your back with your legs extended.
column10: Bend one knee and place your foot flat on the ground.
column11: Using your hands or a towel, gently pull your toes towards your body, feeling a stretch in your calf.
column12: Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
column13: Release the stretch and repeat on the other leg.

column9: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place the band around the ball of your left foot.
column10: Hold onto a stable object for balance if needed.
column11: Slowly raise your left heel off the ground, lifting your body weight onto the ball of your foot.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your left heel back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the right leg.

column5: band single leg reverse calf raise
column9: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place the band around the ball of your foot.
column10: Hold onto a stable object for balance.
column11: Slowly raise your heel off the ground, lifting your body weight onto the ball of your foot.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heel back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch to the other leg.

column5: band two legs calf raise - (band under both legs) v. 2
column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a resistance band under both feet.
column10: Hold the ends of the band with your hands for stability.
column11: Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using your calves.
column12: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Place a barbell on the floor in front of you.
column10: Stand with the balls of your feet on the edge of the barbell, with your heels hanging off.
column11: Hold onto a stable object for balance if needed.
column12: Raise your heels as high as possible, using your calves to lift your body.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a barbell resting on your thighs.
column10: Place the balls of your feet on a raised platform, such as a block or step.
column11: Position the barbell across your thighs and hold it securely with your hands.
column12: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, lift your heels off the ground by extending your ankles.
column13: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Sit on a bench with your feet flat on the floor and a barbell resting on your thighs.
column10: Place the balls of your feet on a raised platform, such as a block or step.
column11: Lower your heels as far as possible, feeling a stretch in your calves.
column12: Raise your heels as high as possible, contracting your calves.
column13: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell across your upper back.
column10: Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using only your toes.
column11: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
column12: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place a barbell across your upper back.
column10: Raise your heels off the ground as high as possible, using your calves.
column11: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your heels back down to the starting position.
column12: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
column12: Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
column13: Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and your arms extended straight down by your sides.
column12: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, slowly bend your torso to one side, lowering your hand towards your knee.
column13: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.
column14: Repeat on the other side.
column15: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie flat on your back with your hands placed behind your head.
column12: Lift your legs off the ground and bend your knees at a 90-degree angle.
column13: Bring your right elbow towards your left knee while simultaneously straightening your right leg.
column14: Return to the starting position and repeat the movement on the opposite side, bringing your left elbow towards your right knee while straightening your left leg.
column15: Continue alternating sides in a pedaling motion for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: arm slingers hanging bent knee legs
column11: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your knees bent at a 90-degree angle.
column12: Engage your core and lift your knees towards your chest, bringing them as close to your elbows as possible.
column13: Slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Hang from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your legs straight down.
column12: Engage your core and lift your legs up in front of you until they are parallel to the ground.
column13: Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: assisted lying leg raise with lateral throw down
column11: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
column12: Place your hands under your glutes for support.
column13: Engage your abs and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight.
column14: While keeping your legs together, lower them to one side until they are a few inches above the ground.
column15: Pause for a moment, then lift your legs back to the starting position.
column16: Repeat the movement to the other side.
column17: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: assisted lying leg raise with throw down
column11: Lie flat on your back with your legs extended and your arms by your sides.
column12: Place your hands under your glutes for support.
column13: Engage your core and lift your legs off the ground, keeping them straight.
column14: Raise your legs until they are perpendicular to the ground.
column15: Lower your legs back down to the starting position.
column16: Simultaneously, throw your legs down towards the ground, keeping them straight.
column17: Raise your legs back up to the starting position.
column18: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Sit on the ground with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.
column12: Hold the medicine ball with both hands in front of your chest.
column13: Lean back slightly, engaging your abs and keeping your back straight.
column14: Slowly twist your torso to the right, bringing the medicine ball towards the right side of your body.
column15: Pause for a moment, then twist your torso to the left, bringing the medicine ball towards the left side of your body.
column16: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
column12: Extend your arms overhead, keeping them straight.
column13: Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is upright.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Sit on the edge of a bench or have someone hold your feet down.
column12: Lie flat on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
column13: Place your hands behind your head with your elbows pointing outwards.
column14: Engaging your abs, slowly lift your upper body off the ground, curling forward until your torso is at a 45-degree angle.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your upper body back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: calves
column11: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and the barbell resting on your upper chest, just below your collarbone.
column12: Hold the barbell with an overhand grip, keeping your elbows up and your upper arms parallel to the ground.
column13: Lower your body down into a squat position by bending at the knees and hips, keeping your back straight and your chest up.
column14: Pause for a moment at the bottom of the squat, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: assisted lying gluteus and piriformis stretch
column11: Lie on your back with your legs extended.
column12: Bend your right knee and place your right ankle on your left thigh, just above the knee.
column13: Grasp your left thigh with both hands and gently pull it towards your chest.
column14: Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
column15: Release the stretch and repeat on the other side.

column11: Start on all fours with your hands directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips.
column12: Extend one leg straight back, keeping your knee bent and your foot flexed.
column13: Slowly lower your hips towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your quads.
column14: Hold this position for 20-30 seconds.
column15: Switch legs and repeat the stretch on the other side.

column9: calves
column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and arms extended to the sides.
column12: Keeping your legs straight, bend forward at the waist and reach down towards your toes with your right hand.
column13: As you reach down, simultaneously lift your left leg straight up behind you, maintaining balance.
column14: Return to the starting position and repeat the movement with your left hand reaching towards your toes and your right leg lifting up behind you.
column15: Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie face down on a mat or bench with your legs fully extended.
column12: Have a partner or use a resistance band to secure your ankles.
column13: Engage your hamstrings and lift your legs towards your glutes, keeping your knees straight.
column14: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie face down on the ground with your legs extended.
column12: Bend your left knee and reach back with your left hand to grab your left foot or ankle.
column13: Gently pull your left foot towards your glutes, feeling a stretch in your left quad.
column14: Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, then release.
column15: Repeat with your right leg.

column9: calves
column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column12: Bend your knees slightly and jump backwards, pushing off with both feet.
column13: Land softly on the balls of your feet, bending your knees to absorb the impact.
column14: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: calves
column11: Set up a barbell on a squat rack at chest height.
column12: Stand facing away from the rack, with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column13: Bend your knees and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest up.
column14: Grasp the barbell with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
column15: Lift the barbell off the rack and step back, ensuring your feet are still shoulder-width apart.
column16: Lower your body down into a squat, keeping your knees in line with your toes.
column17: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
column18: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at ankle height.
column12: Stand facing away from the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column13: Step back to create tension in the band, keeping your knees slightly bent.
column14: Hinge at the hips and lean forward, maintaining a neutral spine.
column15: Extend your right leg straight back, squeezing your glutes at the top.
column16: Lower your right leg back down and repeat with the left leg.
column17: Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie on your side with your legs straight and stacked on top of each other.
column12: Bend your bottom leg slightly for stability.
column13: Place your top foot on a stable surface, such as a bench or step.
column14: Keeping your top leg straight, slowly lower it towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your inner thigh.
column15: Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds.
column16: Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side.

column11: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground.
column12: Place a resistance band just above your knees.
column13: Engage your glutes and core muscles.
column14: Press your heels into the ground and lift your hips off the floor, squeezing your glutes at the top.
column15: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Lie on your back with your legs straight and a resistance band looped around your feet.
column12: Bend your knees and bring them towards your chest, keeping your feet together.
column13: Slowly rotate your knees outwards, away from each other, while keeping your feet together.
column14: Pause for a moment at the end of the rotation, then slowly return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: band one arm single leg split squat
column11: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a resistance band around your ankles.
column12: Extend one leg forward and rest the top of your foot on a bench or step behind you.
column13: Hold onto a support with one hand for balance.
column14: Bend your standing leg and lower your body down into a squat position, keeping your knee in line with your toes.
column15: Push through your heel to return to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions, then switch legs.

column11: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and place a resistance band around your ankles.
column12: Take a big step forward with your right foot and a smaller step back with your left foot.
column13: Bend your knees and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground, keeping your left knee slightly above the ground.
column14: Push through your right heel to return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat on the other side.

column9: calves
column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, with the band placed just above your knees.
column12: Keeping your chest up and core engaged, push your hips back and bend your knees to lower into a squat position.
column13: Make sure your knees are tracking over your toes and your weight is in your heels.
column14: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then push through your heels to return to the starting position.
column15: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: back
column11: Attach the band to a sturdy anchor point at waist height.
column12: Stand facing the anchor point with your feet shoulder-width apart.
column13: Hold the band handles with your palms facing each other and your arms extended in front of you.
column14: Bend your knees and lower into a squat position, keeping your back straight and chest lifted.
column15: From the squat position, pull the band handles towards your body, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
column16: Pause for a moment at the top, then slowly release the tension and return to the starting position.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column9: calves
column11: Place a band around your thighs, just above your knees.
column12: Stand facing a step or platform with your feet hip-width apart.
column13: Step up onto the platform with your right foot, pushing through your heel.
column14: Extend your left leg behind you, keeping it straight.
column15: Lower your left foot back down to the ground.
column16: Repeat with your left foot stepping up onto the platform.
column17: Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.

column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band around your ankles.
column12: Hold the band with both hands in front of your thighs, palms facing your body.
column13: Keeping your back straight and your core engaged, hinge at the hips and slowly lower your upper body towards the ground.
column14: As you lower, push your hips back and allow your knees to bend slightly.
column15: Lower the band towards the ground, feeling a stretch in your hamstrings.
column16: Pause for a moment at the bottom, then engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift your upper body back up to the starting position.
column17: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

column5: band straight back stiff leg deadlift
column11: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and place the band around your upper legs.
column12: Hold the band with both hands in front of your thighs, palms facing your body.
column13: Keeping your back straight and your knees slightly bent, hinge at the hips and lower the band towards the ground.
column14: Feel the stretch in your hamstrings as you lower the band.
column15: Engage your glutes and hamstrings to lift your body back up to the starting position.
column16: Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
